  <h2> <font size="-1"> paypalnvp.util</font> <br> Class Validator</h2> 
  <pre>
java.lang.Object
  <img SRC="../../resources/inherit.gif" ALT="extended by "><b>paypalnvp.util.Validator</b>
</pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dt>
    <b>All Implemented Interfaces:</b> 
   </dt>
   <dd>
    java.io.Serializable
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <dl> 
   <dt>
    <pre>public final class <b>Validator</b>
     <dt>
      extends java.lang.Object
     </dt>
     <dt>
      implements java.io.Serializable
     </dt></pre>
   </dt>
  </dl>  
  <p> Validates common paypal fields. The class is used directly by paypal classes so you can use it for validation before setting certain values in paypal requests or fields. </p>
  <p> </p>
  <p> </p>
  <dl> 
   <dt>
    <b>See Also:</b>
   </dt>
   <dd>
    <a href="../../serialized-form.html#paypalnvp.util.Validator">Serialized Form</a>
   </dd>
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <p>

  <a name="Validator()">

  <h3> Validator</h3> 
  <pre>
public <b>Validator</b>()</pre> 
  <dl> 
  </dl> 
  <!-- ============ METHOD DETAIL ========== --> 
  <a name="method_detail">
   <!-- --></a> 
  <table border="1" width="100%" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" summary=""> 
   <tbody>
    <tr bgcolor="#CCCCFF" class="TableHeadingColor"> 
     <th align="left" colspan="1"><font size="+2"> <b>Method Detail</b></font></th> 
    </tr> 
   </tbody>
  </table> 
  <a name="isValidAmount(java.lang.String)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> isValidAmount</h3> 
  <pre>
public static boolean <b>isValidAmount</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;amount)</pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Validates string if it is amount supported by paypal. Amount has to be exactly two decimal places, decimal point is ".", or 0. You can set 0 for for example Payment when you set up recurring payment. 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>amount</code> - string representing the amount 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Returns:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      true if amount is valid, false otherwise
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="isValidEmail(java.lang.String)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> isValidEmail</h3> 
  <pre>
public static boolean <b>isValidEmail</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;email)</pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Validates email address. Does not validate length of the email, this is because it varies between paypal requests. 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>email</code> - 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Returns:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      true if email is valid, otherwise false
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="isValidLuhn(java.lang.String)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> isValidLuhn</h3> 
  <pre>
public static boolean <b>isValidLuhn</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;number)</pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Uses Luhn algorithm to validate numbers. Luhn algorithm is also known as modulus 10 or mod 10 algorithm. In this case, this is used to validate credit card numbers. 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>number</code> - number to be validated (credit card number) 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Returns:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd></dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl>
